thread.title: Famine in Bombay

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Famine in Bombay
text: THE agricultural outlook in several parts of the Bombay Presidency such as Ahmedbad, Panch Mahals, and Kathiawar shows impeding famine. The total rainfall up to date in these parts does not exceed a fourth of the normal quantity; and all opinions show that the distress will be more acute than of 1911-12. The Government, however, has not yet opened relief works nor declared the famine conditions. Hopes are yet entertained by late rainfall, but when these fail urgent relief operations have to be adopted. Special measures have to be taken to save the cattle as there is water and fodder famine in most affected parts.
